Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Some repos don't show up under Github usage for some packages" (#7355) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Opened issue "[Queue-Back] Handle check validator messages in orchestrator" (#7354) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Merged pull request "Consider a 403 from search in the circuit breaker configuration" (#7353) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Stopped Azure web apps return HTTP 403. We should consider this case for the circuit breaker configuration in light of moving search to web app (for Azure Search).

Note that we do not retry in 403 case as we do with HTTP 500+.

Progress on https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/7119.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Consider a 403 from search in the circuit breaker configuration" (#7353) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody: Stopped Azure web apps return HTTP 403. We should consider this case for the circuit breaker configuration in light of moving search to web app (for Azure Search).

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Consolidate catalog SDKs" (#7352) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.
There are several catalog SDKs in our code base:

1. https://github.com/NuGet/Samples/tree/master/CatalogReaderExample/NuGet.Protocol.Catalog
  * This is what our docs refer to, but this SDK is outdated
2.  https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Services.Metadata/tree/master/src/NuGet.Protocol.Catalog
  * This is an updated copy of the first SDK, and is used by Azure Search 
3. https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Services.Metadata/tree/master/src/Catalog
  * This is an old SDK that is used by most of nuget.org's jobs.

### Describe the solution you'd like
We should consolidate these catalog SDKs into a single package that's published to nuget.org. Our documentation should be updated to point to this new SDK

### Additional context
N/A

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Update jQuery" (#7349) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Taking the update to jQuery 3.x

Mitigates an XSS attack.

Removed reference to removed apis.
Used https://github.com/jquery/jquery-migrate/blob/master/warnings.md#jqmigrate-jqueryfndelegate-is-deprecated for warning and https://jquery.com/upgrade-guide/3.0/ for upgrade assistance.

Did not remove use of deprecated apis.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "NuGet.VisualStudio has dependencies on unofficial Microsoft packages" (#8343) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
This package: https://www.nuget.org/packages/NuGet.VisualStudio/5.1.0 has a dependency on this package https://www.nuget.org/packages/VSSDK.TemplateWizardInterface/ and a bunch of other non-Microsoft provided packages.

This indirectly causes http://github.com/dotnet/project-system to have a dependency on these packages. Please remove this dependency, it is causing us to have duplicate references/double-writes to the following assemblies:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1103906/61429998-c6001600-a96b-11e9-87db-6dc69345f280.png)

The assemblies with the vssdk prefix are not Microsoft-provided packages.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Locked-mode restore fails with sha512 errors & installs new packages when a project's RuntimeIdentifier is changed" (#8260) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

dotnet.exe --version: Both 3.0.100-preview5-011568 and 2.2.204

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

### Automated repro
I've created a self-contained automated repro. You can run it by downloading 
[repro_runtimeIdLockFile.zip](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/files/3322730/repro_runtimeIdLockFile.zip) and running repro.bat

### General behavior:
1. Create a csproj targeting runtime identifier A
2. `dotnet restore --use-locked-file`
3. Change the runtime identifier to B
4. `dotnet restore --locked-mode`

### Expected behavior
1. The second restore should fail with ` error NU1004: The packages lock file is inconsistent with the project dependencies so restore can't be run in locked mode. Please disable RestoreLockedMode MSBuild property or pass explicit --force-evaluate flag to run restore to update the lock file.`
2. The second restore should **not** install any packages (it's in locked mode)

### Actual behavior
1. The second restore fails with `error NU1403: The package runtime.osx-x64.Microsoft.NETCore.App.2.1.10 sha512 validation failed. The package is different than the last restore.`
2. The second restore installs OSX runtime packages

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "The PM UI should not be refreshed if the UI is not visible" (#8339) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
It's a waste of cycles, as the reload would happen happen anyways, when the control is loaded (the loaded event).

Related: 

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.windows.frameworkelement.loaded?view=netframework-4.8
https://blogs.msdn.microsoft.com/mikehillberg/2006/09/19/the-loaded-event-and-the-initialized-event/

//cc @dtivel

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Alpanov/restore manager spec" (#8341) at NuGet/Home
Opened issue "Binding redirect not added when update the NuGet packages" (#8340) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Hi  

I have tried to update the NuGet packages in my ASP.NET MVC Project. NuGet packages updated to the latest assembly, but the bonding redirect entries is not added in the web config file. 

Replication:
1. Create the ASP.NET MVC application
2. Update the NuGet packages using NuGet update command
3. Check the web config entries and the binding redirect is not updated in the web config file 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8706341/61370682-a5bf5100-a8b0-11e9-8b25-27f274681f46.png)


Could you please suggest the solution on this?

Thanks

Ganesan R.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Used -DependencyVersion Highest but non-latest version installed" (#8327) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
I am confused about the behavior of `Install-Package` when executed from Visual Studio's Package Manager Console.  I am using `-DependencyVersion Highest` but a less-than-highest version is being installed, and I don't understand why.

## Details about Problem

NuGet product used: Package Manager Console Host Version 5.1.0.6013
NuGet version: 3.5.0.1938
VS version: Visual Studio Enterprise 2019 version 16.1.5
OS version: Windows 10 v1803 (17134.885)

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1. Observe that the [NuGet package of `Serilog.AspNetCore`](https://www.nuget.org/packages/Serilog.AspNetCore/2.1.1) depends on `Microsoft.Extensions.Logging (>= 2.0.0)`.

2. Observe that the latest release (i.e., non-preview) version of [`Microsoft.Extensions.Logging`](https://www.nuget.org/packages/Microsoft.Extensions.Logging/) (as of this writing) is 2.2.0.

3. In the Package Manager Console of Visual Studio, run `Install-Package Serilog.AspNetCore -DependencyVersion Highest`.

4.  Observe that version 2.0.0 of `Microsoft.Extensions.Logging` was installed (also see logs below).

## Expected behavior

I expected version 2.2.0 of `Microsoft.Extensions.Logging` to be installed since I used `-DependencyVersion Highest`.

Something I wonder is if there are additional implicit constraints that caused 2.0.0 to be installed instead of 2.2.0.  That would explain this behavior, but then I want to know how to make those implicit constraints explicit.

## Other suggested things

### (Non-Verbose) Logs
```
PM> Install-Package Serilog.AspNetCore -DependencyVersion Highest
Restoring packages for C:\Users\twilliams\Documents\Visual Studio 2017\Projects\Temp\Temp\Temp.csproj...
Installing NuGet package Serilog.AspNetCore 2.1.1.
Committing restore...
Writing assets file to disk. Path: C:\Users\twilliams\Documents\Visual Studio 2017\Projects\Temp\Temp\obj\project.assets.json
Restore completed in 212.54 ms for C:\Users\twilliams\Documents\Visual Studio 2017\Projects\Temp\Temp\Temp.csproj.
Successfully installed 'Microsoft.AspNetCore.Hosting.Abstractions 2.0.0' to Temp
Successfully installed 'Microsoft.AspNetCore.Hosting.Server.Abstractions 2.0.0' to Temp
Successfully installed 'Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Abstractions 2.0.0' to Temp
Successfully installed 'Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Features 2.0.0' to Temp
Successfully installed 'Microsoft.Extensions.Configuration.Abstractions 2.0.0' to Temp
Successfully installed 'Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection 2.0.0' to Temp
Successfully installed 'Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.Abstractions 2.0.0' to Temp
Successfully installed 'Microsoft.Extensions.FileProviders.Abstractions 2.0.0' to Temp
Successfully installed 'Microsoft.Extensions.Hosting.Abstractions 2.0.0' to Temp
Successfully installed 'Microsoft.Extensions.Logging 2.0.0' to Temp
Successfully installed 'Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.Abstractions 2.0.0' to Temp
Successfully installed 'Microsoft.Extensions.Options 2.0.0' to Temp
Successfully installed 'Microsoft.Extensions.Primitives 2.0.0' to Temp
Successfully installed 'Serilog 2.5.0' to Temp
Successfully installed 'Serilog.AspNetCore 2.1.1' to Temp
Successfully installed 'Serilog.Extensions.Logging 2.0.0' to Temp
Successfully installed 'System.Runtime.CompilerServices.Unsafe 4.4.0' to Temp
Successfully installed 'System.Text.Encodings.Web 4.4.0' to Temp
Executing nuget actions took 622.13 ms
Time Elapsed: 00:00:01.3739645
```

### Sample Project

Here is a zip of the solution I used to create the above logs.

[Temp.zip](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/files/3387928/Temp.zip)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "The PM UI should not be refreshed if the UI is not visible" (#8339) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
It's a waste of cycles, as the reload would happen happen anyways, when the control is loaded (the loaded event).

Related: 

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.windows.frameworkelement.loaded?view=netframework-4.8
https://blogs.msdn.microsoft.com/mikehillberg/2006/09/19/the-loaded-event-and-the-initialized-event/

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Restore with RestoreLockedMode  and no lock file should error." (#8338) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

The restore with RestoreLockedMode  = true and no lock file does not work or error but a new lock file is created. 

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1. Create a project with RestoreLockedMode = true and delete the lock file if present.

2. Build/restore. 

Result: No error and the lock file is created.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Nuget restore on VS solution open throws exceptions" (#8302) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
OS version: Win 10 Enterprise (1709) 16299.1217
Visual Studio 2017 15.9.13

We recently changed our projects to the sdk-style format (excluding 3 Winforms projects). Since the change, Nuget restore throws several exceptions when opening the solution.
(I understand that Nuget restore is called automatically when the solution opens if you have sdk-style projects)

Error occurred while restoring NuGet packages: System.InvalidOperationException: The operation failed as details for project XYZZY  could not be loaded.
   at NuGet.PackageManagement.VisualStudio.NetCorePackageReferenceProject.GetPackageSpecsAsync(DependencyGraphCacheContext context)
   at NuGet.PackageManagement.DependencyGraphRestoreUtility.<GetSolutionRestoreSpec>d__6.MoveNext()

Manual restore (via the solution context menu) is disabled for 60-90 seconds while this happens, but after that, manual restore is very fast (everything is up to date).
If I close and open the solution, it happens again, despite the fact that nothing has changed.

We have 150 projects in our solution. The nuget exception always occurs on project XYZZY for me (though a colleague sees different projects). This project is a very simple one, with 1 nuget dependency (that every project has) and 1 project dependency.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Tests:  tests not cleaning up" (#8337) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: Some package signing-related tests open handles on files but do not close them properly. Thus, these tests fail to clean up after themselves.
